trigger_event: After another tense night at Bar 101, Oksana listens as Alex, the bartender, shares firsthand stories from regulars whose lives have been thrown into chaos by mistaken BCI identity swaps. One customer breaks down crying as they describe being locked out of their own home.
dilemma: Oksana must choose to either back the rollout of Predictive Guidance Assistants to restore hope and order using technology — or endorse harsh military controls, risking deep scars but ensuring rapid stability.
reason: Haunted by the suffering she's witnessed and torn between her distrust of both faulty algorithms and brute force, Oksana fears whichever choice she makes will set a permanent tone for Stenograd's future.
choice_a: Quietly endorse deploying Predictive Guidance Assistants across the city, hoping that open feedback and visible adaptation can win back public trust and restore order peacefully.
belief_a: Belief that transparent technology can still be corrected and improved with community input.
Hope that humane, adaptive systems can regain people's trust over time.
Conviction that forceful control would only breed lasting trauma and division among citizens.
choice_b: Privately warn the Directorate that disorder is too great, pushing for strict military measures—curfews, checkpoints, and containment—to quickly reimpose stability even at a human cost.
belief_b: Belief that only immediate, visible order can prevent total system collapse and violence.
Fear that letting chaos spiral further will permanently fracture the city’s social bonds.
Doubt that public faith in technology can be restored before irreversible harm sets in.
